title: SIMposium 2015 Gathers America’s Most Innovative IT Leaders to Accelerate Success, Navigate Evolving Technologies
text:
Society for Information Management 
CHARLOTTE, N.C. -- (BUSINESS WIRE) -- The Society for Information Management (SIM), an association of more than 4,500 CIOs and IT leaders, announced today that approximately 500 members from across the Americas are expected to attend SIMposium 2015 , the premier IT practitioner-driven leadership conference being held in Charlotte, North Carolina, from Nov. 1-3, 2015. 
The theme of SIMposium is “innovation” in all aspects, from business to business life. The combined business, technology and leadership conference will bring together highly influential CIOs, CTOs and senior IT executives to discuss, learn and engage with each other on business issues and best practices. Attendees will hear from some of the industry’s most prominent thought-leaders, including Scott Blandford (CIO for the Retirement and Individual Services business at TIAA-CREF), Joseph Bruhin (SVP & CIO for Constellation Brands, Inc.), Patricia Coffey (SVP of Allstate Insurance) and others , to gain insights on what’s driving today’s rapidly changing business environment. 
The featured keynote speakers include Frank Abagnale, acclaimed subject of the book, movie and Broadway play “Catch Me If You Can,” and author and comedian Ross Shafer. 
Featured discussion topics include: The Secret of Extraordinary Results : Curt Coffman, senior partner, chief science officer of the Coffman Organization will share why success directly ties to a corporation’s structure and organization. Performing Under Pressure : Morag Barrett, CEO of Skye Team, leads an interactive session exploring the science beyond emotional reactions and how to manage them when times get tough. Business & IT Alignment : A session explaining how organizations can overcome challenges and bridge the gap between evolving business units and IT into a manageable portfolio. Leadership Dynamics : Zackarie Lemelle, CEO, New Hope Coaching & Consulting (retired Johnson & Johnson) leads a workshop on building an engaged and energized IT organization for innovation and growth. 
SIM’s leadership will detail the full results from its annual SIM IT Trends Study, with preliminary findings suggesting that the practice and profession of IT management has entered a new era. 
In advance of the release of the SIM IT Trends Study, Dr. Leon Kappelman, professor of IS and chief scientist of the study, will highlight its key findings during a one-hour digital media briefing on Oct. 14, 2015, at 1:00 p.m. ET. 
Now in its 36th year, the SIM study surveyed more than 1,200 CIOs and IT leaders to gain insights on topics including budgets, salaries and headcounts to create an unbiased report of industry trends. 
The digital media briefing participants will receive a free, embargoed digital copy of the study, engage in a live Q&A session with Kappelman and gain future access to interviews with expert resources, researchers and SIM members. Press may RSVP for the digital media briefing here . 
Press may register for free admission to SIMposium 2015 by contacting Allison Menozzi. A full SIMposium schedule, including detailed information on each featured speaker, is listed on the SIMposium website . 
About The Society for Information Management (SIM) 
Established in 1968, the Society for Information Management (SIM) is the premier network for IT leaders composed of more than 4,500 members including CIOs, senior IT executives, prominent academicians, consultants, and other IT leaders. SIM is an objective community of thought leaders who share experiences and apply rich intellectual capital, and who explore future IT direction. Through its 34 chapters, SIM provides resources and programs inspired by IT leaders for IT leaders that enable CIOs to further develop the leadership capabilities of themselves and the key and emerging leaders in their organizations. SIM provides the collective voice to advocate policy and legislation on behalf of the IT profession across industries.
